data.title: Great Monday Night Pizza Prices
data.text: I have been going her for over 10years always fresh and delicious !  Great service... We love the Sicilian Pizza!!  Best in South Florida!!

data.title: Best pizza delivery
data.text: Used to order pizza for many years from another local place. Been very disappointed for a long time so I stopped ordering delivery in my area. Today I dared to try Dean Anthony's and I got to say I have a new pizza place and I'm so excited about it as I do not like to settle. I ordered a large pizza with half spicy salami and ham and half chicken Alfredo with bacon. The taste of the sauce was so fresh and the combination of both choices balanced one another. 👍

data.title: Pizza Delight
data.text: We tried this pizza a few months ago and it was great. Nice to see it was great again! I did read some unkind reviews about other food they serve but the pizza both times was so good this is our new place. Staff is very nice and good deal for the price.

data.title: May Be Good For Pizza - NOT FOR ANYTHING ELSE!
data.text: Last weekend we went to Dean Anthonys for the first time.  For starters we ordered caesar salads.  After waiting 15 minutes we flagged down another server and told him we wanted to see our server.  Our server appoligized saying he had forgotten to tell us that the restaurant was out of romaine lettuce and they had sent someone to the supermarket to get some.  And early on a Saturday night!   No Caesar salads!  The minestrone soup tasted like salty boullion with a few vegetables floating in it.  My pasta fagole had been pulverized so that you couldn't distinguish the ingredients.  The veal picatta arrived swimming in a starchy sauch that was also so salty it was inedible. My husband requested no sauce on his side of pasta.  No surprise that he got the pasta with tomato sauce. We had to wait 20 minutes for bread and were served garlic rolls when we had requested plain rolls. The broccoli was overcooked. Need I say more!  Everyone around us was eating pizza. Obfviously that's what they do best.  I have never experienced such poor service and food. They won't see us again!

data.title: Tasty pizza
data.text: We've had this pizza before on visits when we are here to visit family. It's good pizza (for Florida). The service was good and the staff was friendly. We've had the sausage and mushroom and pepperoni pizzas. Good crust and good sauce. Haven't tried the other entrees as yet, but may do so on another visit.

data.title: Great Pizza
data.text: We tried Dean Anthony's Pizza for the first time last weekend and it was delicious. We got the Mozzarella, Artichoke and Spinach pizza

data.title: Best Thin Crust Pizza
data.text: Pizza lovers seem to enjoy different versions of this culinary delight. My husband and I favor the thin-crust style. If this is your choice, Dean Anthony offers the best pizza we have found and it is consistently delicious.  They offer take out and dine in and a Monday night special price of $10 for a large cheese pie.  Their breads, salads and other Italian dishes are also excellent and the service matches the quality of their products. We were fortunate when a friend introduced us to Dean Anthony's and we have become devoted customers.

data.title: Over an hour for pizza delivery
data.text: We ordered a pizza for delivery and were told 30-45 mins. At 45 mins we called and they said "he's leaving now". Mind you they are located at least 15 minutes from us. Seriously? Not really worth the wait after all. They didn't seem to care that we've been waiting so they obviously won't care to lose another customer!!

data.title: Great pizza, hot restaurant.
data.text: Love the pizza here and we have eaten here many times, but it is just uncomfortably hot in the restaurant to have an enjoyable meal.  I understand the older crowd doesn't like the cool air, but they can wear a sweater (and they do).  Since shorts, shirt, and flip flops is about as lightly clothed you can be, we have opted to have pizza nearer to home.  It isn't as good but it is cool inside and we don't break a sweat eating dinner.

data.title: Fair food home delivery
data.text: had my meal delivered. Was prompt delivery in ,less time than was quoted. Food was a little pricey but pasta dinner was a good amount. Standard boxed pasta used and over cooked. Tomato meat sauce was flavorless. Egg plant was good. Fee charged was more than quoted by about $3 plus they charge $2 for delivery.

data.title: Okay
data.text: We've eaten here many times over the years, with no complaints. We normally get pizza, which is very good. The other night, I decided to get chicken parm. It wasn't very good, sadly. And it was pretty expensive for what it was. I realize they must keep competitive prices, but 17.00 is a bit steep. I could feed the whole family for 17.00 if I made chicken parm myself. I like this place, because it's a neighborhood pizzeria and I support local businesses. But I hope they improve their food a bit. Specifically, their sauce. It tasted like nothing but tomato paste. No flavor whatsoever and acidic,which was very unappetizing served atop a bit of bland spaghetti alongside the chicken. I'm from NYC, and I do know good pizza. DA has good pizza. But please, improve the sauce. An Italian Eatery must have great sauce. I don't mean to criticize, I just do not want their restaurant falling into trouble. On a better note, our server was a very sweet young man who was friendly and attentive. Thanks

data.title: Great pizza
data.text: We have had pizza at Dean Anthony's twice, once was take out and once eat in. In both cases, the Pizza was excellent. The crust was thin, the way we like it and the topping was great. One that we had was the Veggie and it was superb. It is family friendly for all generations. There is even a great singer a couple of nights a week. Enjoy!!

data.title: Pretty good
data.text:
Having trouble with pizza lately. 
Figured on giving them a shot. 
Wings were really good, a little more well done than a lot of places. I like that. Pizza was pretty good as well. I did takeout and was ready when they said it would be. The only down side was the price. $29 for 10 wings and a medium pizza. I'd have to think long and hard about doing it again. 
Ooh well. On to the next one.

data.title: Fresh Pizza
data.text:
We had a good time on Saturday night. We went in around 8ish and there was live music and the performer sounded really good. The place was pretty quiet for a Saturday night. We were sat immediately and the server was over within a minute. 

The service overall was excellent. The hostess was friendly. Our server was busy so he sent someone over to grab our drink order. When he returned, he was friendly was accurate with our order. 

The pizza was so fresh. I could tell by the crust. My Caesar salad was great to and the croutons were super yummy. I tried my friend bruschetta and it tasted great as well. I recommend all three. 

Overall we had a great meal. We has a coupon from a local coupon book so the meal was $32 for 4 people. Can't beat that!

data.title: A Head's Up to the Owners
data.text: I love the pizza here, and I go every Saturday for the lunch special BUT for the past one or two months, I've noticed whenever the owners are not there, the service isn't what it should be or used to be.  For one, there was a time when I overheard one of the female servers using a specific vulgar term over and over when describing a smell to a fellow co-worker, all within earshot of the people dining.  Today I went in for lunch and there was a senior couple sitting in a booth with water glasses.  We sat down in a booth and waited for the waitress.  We heard people in the kitchen area, but nobody came to our table (and we are familiar with waitress who worked saturdays).  We waited some more.  I got up saw an unfamiliar face over by the Take Out area--a young girl I'd never seen before working there--and some dude making pizza. Both saw me but made no attempt to acknowledge me.  I sat down and we waited another couple of minutes.  Nothing.  We got up and left.  I hope the owners read this and realize they will lose customers if their staff don't do their jobs and acknowledge the people who are (were) regulars, especially.  There ARE other pizza places in Boynton--plenty--but we do like their pizza.  We will miss it if things don't get better.

data.title: It's OK but it's not like New York as some people say
data.text:
Not sure if it's New York "style", maybe the size of the crust, people refer to but it is not New York taste.

Ordered a half sausage and onion, half cheese.  It was not bad pizza, but I didn't think "WOW, this is good pizza!" at all.  

The toppings were "extremely" few.  I mean, seriously ... On the largest pie, I just went and counted and there were no more than four VERY thin slices of round sausage on each slice,  I took a piece off to eat on it's own, and, really, it was too thin and so flavorless ... they need bigger chunks so you can actually taste it -- what is the point, otherwise?

I was surprised when I opened the box and saw so few pieces of meat on the pizza - and unimpressed with how thin those slices were and the lack of flavor.  

So no, to me this is not the best place in Boynton.  It's not horrible, but I don't think "Wow, I want to come back!"  

Recently tried the eggplant parm sub, too, and it's OK - just again, nothing to write home about.  Not BAD, but not great.  The cheese could have more flavor for sure.

data.title: The Best Pizza in Town
data.text: The first time that we went to Dean Anthony's was in Feb 2011 when my daughter picked me up at the WPB Airport and wanted me to hear Franco Corso who does tributes to Andrea Bocelli. She had seen a sign in Dean's window. She had never heard of Franco before, but knew that I loved Andrea. We didn't even go home first. We went straight to Dean's from the airport. We were not disappointed. Franco is great and so is the pizza and salad. My family lives in Lake Worth and still only get their pizza from Dean's. We like the friendly atmosphere due to Dean and his family. You'll like it. MaryMary

data.title: Not thier best night
data.text: This was not their best night. Been there a few time, usually pretty good. Tonight (and yes it was a Friday) took 20 minutes to get a drink, waiter keep brining me soup.... not mine dude I ordered a salad. Then our pizza arrived burned, the waiter didn't appear phased at all. Dropped it and ran........ not cool guys.

data.title: Good food and live music
data.text: We visited on a busy Saturday night. The food took a little long to come out, but it was good and there was a ton of it. They had a singer singing Sinatra style songs. He was fantastic...it made the whole experience.

data.title: Too noisy to talk
data.text: This place did not live up to the reviews I had seen.  The pizza was over cooked, so the crust was hard,  The toppings were few & far between.  1 of the other guests at our table ordered an entree, & that looked a bit better & it was a large portion, but over all I was NOT impressed.  They also had a singer there, but they turned up the volume so loud that it was not pleasant & it prevented any of us from talking to the others at the table.  This was not a place I would want to return to.
